intro: Manihot arenaria, commonly known as the desert arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Manihot. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its latex contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans.
